intro: Elaphrium ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaf elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are oval-shaped and have a distinctive, fragrant scent. Elaphrium ovalifolium produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family.
